item.title: Error occurred during vCenter operation when editing a VMware Horizon View pool
item.description: When editing a VMware Horizon desktop pool in some situations the server error ‘Error occurred during vCenter operation’. appears. The error hasn’t any useful information that says what is wrong. When this error occurs the vCenter Server is unable to find one or more objects listed in the desktop pool. When changing datacenter, cluster or host settings in vCenter the desktop pool must be updated to. To resolve this error open the desktop pool, select the vCenter settings tab an check or update the Parent VM, Snapshot, Host or cluster, Resource pool and datastores.

item.title: The VMware VirtualCenter Server service terminated unexpectedly
item.description: After rebooting the VMware VirtualCenter (VC) server, i was unable to logon using the VI-client in VC. In the Windows event log the following Error is listed: Event Type: Error Event Source: Service Control Manager Event Category: None Event ID: 7031 Date: 25-9-2008 Time: 13:39:58 User: N/A Computer: VC1 Description: The VMware VirtualCenter Server service terminated unexpectedly. It has done this 1 time(s). The following corrective action will be taken in 300000 milliseconds: Restart the service.
